   18635             : 
   18636             : 
   18637             : /*
   18638             :  * BuildArchiveDependencies - create dependency data for archive TOC entries
   18639             :  *
   18640             :  * The raw dependency data obtained by getDependencies() is not terribly
   18641             :  * useful in an archive dump, because in many cases there are dependency
   18642             :  * chains linking through objects that don't appear explicitly in the dump.
   18643             :  * For example, a view will depend on its _RETURN rule while the _RETURN rule
   18644             :  * will depend on other objects --- but the rule will not appear as a separate
   18645             :  * object in the dump.  We need to adjust the view's dependencies to include
   18646             :  * whatever the rule depends on that is included in the dump.
   18647             :  *
   18648             :  * Just to make things more complicated, there are also "special" dependencies
   18649             :  * such as the dependency of a TABLE DATA item on its TABLE, which we must
   18650             :  * not rearrange because pg_restore knows that TABLE DATA only depends on
   18651             :  * its table.  In these cases we must leave the dependencies strictly as-is
   18652             :  * even if they refer to not-to-be-dumped objects.
   18653             :  *
   18654             :  * To handle this, the convention is that "special" dependencies are created
   18655             :  * during ArchiveEntry calls, and an archive TOC item that has any such
   18656             :  * entries will not be touched here.  Otherwise, we recursively search the
   18657             :  * DumpableObject data structures to build the correct dependencies for each
   18658             :  * archive TOC item.
   18659             :  */
   18660             : static void
   18661          58 : BuildArchiveDependencies(Archive *fout)
   18662             : {
   18663          58 :     ArchiveHandle *AH = (ArchiveHandle *) fout;
   18664             :     TocEntry   *te;
   18665             : 
   18666             :     /* Scan all TOC entries in the archive */
   18667        8330 :     for (te = AH->toc->next; te != AH->toc; te = te->next)
   18668             :     {
   18669             :         DumpableObject *dobj;
   18670             :         DumpId     *dependencies;
   18671             :         int         nDeps;
   18672             :         int         allocDeps;
   18673             : 
   18674             :         /* No need to process entries that will not be dumped */
   18675        8272 :         if (te->reqs == 0)
   18676        2400 :             continue;
   18677             :         /* Ignore entries that already have "special" dependencies */
   18678        8268 :         if (te->nDeps > 0)
   18679        1892 :             continue;
   18680             :         /* Otherwise, look up the item's original DumpableObject, if any */
   18681        6376 :         dobj = findObjectByDumpId(te->dumpId);
   18682        6376 :         if (dobj == NULL)
   18683         298 :             continue;
   18684             :         /* No work if it has no dependencies */
   18685        6078 :         if (dobj->nDeps <= 0)
   18686         206 :             continue;
   18687             :         /* Set up work array */
   18688        5872 :         allocDeps = 64;
   18689        5872 :         dependencies = (DumpId *) pg_malloc(allocDeps * sizeof(DumpId));
   18690        5872 :         nDeps = 0;
   18691             :         /* Recursively find all dumpable dependencies */
   18692        5872 :         findDumpableDependencies(AH, dobj,
   18693             :                                  &dependencies, &nDeps, &allocDeps);
   18694             :         /* And save 'em ... */
   18695        5872 :         if (nDeps > 0)
   18696             :         {
   18697        4336 :             dependencies = (DumpId *) pg_realloc(dependencies,
   18698             :                                                  nDeps * sizeof(DumpId));
   18699        4336 :             te->dependencies = dependencies;
   18700        4336 :             te->nDeps = nDeps;
   18701             :         }
   18702             :         else
   18703        1536 :             free(dependencies);
   18704             :     }
   18705          58 : }
   18706             : 
   18707             : /* Recursive search subroutine for BuildArchiveDependencies */
   18708             : static void
   18709       14934 : findDumpableDependencies(ArchiveHandle *AH, const DumpableObject *dobj,
   18710             :                          DumpId **dependencies, int *nDeps, int *allocDeps)
   18711             : {
   18712             :     int         i;
   18713             : 
   18714             :     /*
   18715             :      * Ignore section boundary objects: if we search through them, we'll
   18716             :      * report lots of bogus dependencies.
   18717             :      */
   18718       14934 :     if (dobj->objType == DO_PRE_DATA_BOUNDARY ||
   18719       14922 :         dobj->objType == DO_POST_DATA_BOUNDARY)
   18720        2538 :         return;
   18721             : 
   18722       30866 :     for (i = 0; i < dobj->nDeps; i++)
   18723             :     {
   18724       18470 :         DumpId      depid = dobj->dependencies[i];
   18725             : 
   18726       18470 :         if (TocIDRequired(AH, depid) != 0)
   18727             :         {
   18728             :             /* Object will be dumped, so just reference it as a dependency */
   18729        9408 :             if (*nDeps >= *allocDeps)
   18730             :             {
   18731           0 :                 *allocDeps *= 2;
   18732           0 :                 *dependencies = (DumpId *) pg_realloc(*dependencies,
   18733           0 :                                                       *allocDeps * sizeof(DumpId));
   18734             :             }
   18735        9408 :             (*dependencies)[*nDeps] = depid;
   18736        9408 :             (*nDeps)++;
   18737             :         }
   18738             :         else
   18739             :         {
   18740             :             /*
   18741             :              * Object will not be dumped, so recursively consider its deps. We
   18742             :              * rely on the assumption that sortDumpableObjects already broke
   18743             :              * any dependency loops, else we might recurse infinitely.
   18744             :              */
   18745        9062 :             DumpableObject *otherdobj = findObjectByDumpId(depid);
   18746             : 
   18747        9062 :             if (otherdobj)
   18748        9062 :                 findDumpableDependencies(AH, otherdobj,
   18749             :                                          dependencies, nDeps, allocDeps);
   18750             :         }
   18751             :     }
   18752             : }
   18753             : 
   18754             : 
   18755             : /*
   18756             :  * getFormattedTypeName - retrieve a nicely-formatted type name for the

   18873             : /*

   18952           2 :                     break;

   18954           2 :                     simple_string_list_append(&tabledata_exclude_patterns_and_children,
   18955             :                                               objname);
   18956           2 :                     break;

   18958           4 :                     simple_string_list_append(&schema_exclude_patterns, objname);
   18959           4 :                     break;
   18960           4 :                 case FILTER_OBJECT_TYPE_TABLE:
   18961           4 :                     simple_string_list_append(&table_exclude_patterns, objname);
   18962           4 :                     break;
